body:
<!--
**Note:**
- Do not use the bug and feature tracker for support requests. Use the `cython-users` mailing list instead.
- Did you search for similar issues already? Please do, it helps to save us precious time that we otherwise could not invest into development.
- Did you try the latest master branch or pre-release? It might already have what you want to report. Also see the [Changelog](https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/master/CHANGES.rst) regarding recent changes.
-->

With the release of the [PEP 632](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0632/) it's recommended to move from distutils, and we can probably go with it with the new backwards-compatibility-breaking 3.0 version. Distutils will be removed eventually and therefore transition will happen sooner or later, so we have to be prepared.

AFAIK cython have at least partial support of setuptools, so transition should not be as hard.

comment_data.body:
@scoder @da-woods I would like to hear some thoughts of yours about this.
Do we need to consider this now and switch in 3.0 or 3.1?

What exactly are you proposing to change?

* for Cython's own setup.py we prefer setuptools but support distutils as a backup - that seems fine for now. I'd suggest we remove the backup only when it becomes a problem.
* It looks like most of the examples in the docs use setuptools - if we've missed any then we should update those
* directives like `#distutils: language=c++`? We definitely shouldn't break those (but we might support `#setuptools: language` as a synonym?)
* The parts where we monkey-patch distutils to work with Cython - I think this should keep working for quite a while.
* pyximport - I don't know. Maybe this should be updated to use setuptools?
* tests - maybe should be update to use setuptools (except if they're specifically testing distutils)

So I don't think a lot should change except some of the tests.

> What exactly are you proposing to change?

Well, first of all, I think it would be nice to have the ability to run cython solely on setuptools, like if there's no distutils, so the first step is to patch any functionality that's implemented only with distutils so it will also support setuptools.
The second step to do is to just drop the usage of the distutils and make setuptools a requirement for cython (that doesn't seem like a big problem)

We can do the first step right now, and wait until

> it becomes a problem

to do the second step

So all of those things you mentioned are relevant fixes for the first step.

> * The parts where we monkey-patch distutils to work with Cython - I think this should keep working for quite a while.

the whole idea is that distutils will be removed and we need to have a replacement before this will happen

> > * The parts where we monkey-patch distutils to work with Cython - I think this should keep working for quite a while.
> 
> the whole idea is that distutils will be removed and we need to have a replacement before this will happen

I think you're misunderstanding what I'm saying slightly: I'm in favour of it being possible to build Cython without distutils. I'm not in favour of stopping other people using Cython with distutils at this stage)

Py2.7 doesn't have `ensurepip`, so _relying_ on setuptools in Cython 3.0 doesn't seem like a good idea. However, _preferring_ it over distutils, if available, seems worthwhile.

For Cython 3.1, I think relying on setuptools should be ok. I don't see a need to do so, though, until we're gaining better integration with setuptools than with distutils, i.e. until setuptools _does_ something for us. Also see #2531.

> I'm not in favour of stopping other people using Cython with distutils at this stage)

I see, I do not insist on removing this possibility right now, but it'll be nice to be able to do this without any problems, because at some point if we want to support new python versions then we will need to be able to use only setuptools

distutils will be removed in python `3.12`, python `3.12.0-final` should be released at 2023-10-03 or 2023-10-02 so it's like 2 yeas from now.

Tbh I don't know how big of the problem it is to make cython able to run only with setuptools, but taking into account the speed of the contribution to cython and a relatively small amount of the time that regular contributors can give, I guess, we should consider this right now.

da-woods already mentioned some places to look at, so we can probably start with it.

> I don't see a need to do so, though, until we're gaining better integration with setuptools than with distutils, i.e. until setuptools _does_ something for us

@scoder sorry, I don't really understand, but the removal of distutils doesn't add any needed in this?

> > I don't see a need to do so, though, until we're gaining better integration with setuptools than with distutils, i.e. until setuptools _does_ something for us
> 
> @scoder sorry, I don't really understand, but the removal of distutils doesn't add any needed in this?

Not as long as we can easily support both with a conditional/fallback import.

milestone.description: Remove support for Python 2 and Python < 3.5. Maybe also for Python 3.5, TBD.

title: [ENH] Switch to using only `setuptools` (PEP 632)
